result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathleen Ann Neumann

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appeared in person and informed the Court she does not have Zoom capabilities and requests an in person date. Court adjourned case off the record and informed parties of the new date.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's Department Store.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathleen Ann Neumann not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office has cleared the active warrant, provided the next court date to the defendant, and requested the warrant be withdrawn with approval of Deputy Chief Judge Carl Ashley. MCSO advised defendant to appear in Room 221 of the Safety Building, in person, at 1:00 PM on 8/29/22.  Return on warrant/Initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
